item.title: Equal Justice for Our Military Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6334)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6334)

summary.text:
Equal Justice for Our Military Act of 2011 - Amends the federal judicial code to allow for review by writ of certiorari of certain cases denied relief or review by the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces.

Declares that the time for application for such a writ shall be as prescribed by rules of the Supreme Court.

bill.title: Equal Justice for Our Military Act of 2011

item.title: Equal Justice for Our Military Act of 2011
A bill to amend titles 28 and 10, United States Code, to allow for certiorari review of certain cases denied relief or review by the United States Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces.
Equal Justice for Our Military Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6334)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
